However, fate does have its irony."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………普通に考えれば、これはそう読み取れるでしょう。１３人の生贄を捧げれば、魔女が蘇ると読み取れる、謎の儀式。……しかし、本当の儀式はそれではない。……奇跡的に解ける誰かを待つ。そちらこそが、本当の儀式。しかし、運命とは皮肉なもの」
Russian (RU): "......Таково привычное толкование. Таинственный ритуал, приносящий в жертву 13 человек для возрождения ведьмы. ......Однако это не настоящий ритуал. ......Настоящий заключается в ожидании того, кто чудом разгадает эту загадку. Вот истинный ритуал. Но у судьбы своя ирония."

PC Japanese (JP): 「そうだ。………これは私が人生の最後に望む、最後の奇跡。最後の魔法なのだ。……あの難解な碑文の謎が解ける奇跡が訪れた時、………きっとそれは、ベアトリーチェの復活を意味するのだ。……おぉ、ベアトリーチェよ…。見たい、もう一度その面影が見たい…。もはや富も名誉も何も要らぬ。そなたに最後に一目、会うことが出来たなら……！」
Russian (RU): "Именно. ......Это последнее чудо, нужное мне при жизни. Моя последняя магия. ......Когда чудо случится и позволит человеку разгадать эту сложную эпитафию...... {f:5:Беатриче} обязательно воскреснет. ......О‐о‐о, {f:5:Беатриче}... Я просто хочу ещё раз увидеть твоё лицо... Мне больше не нужны богатство и честь. Вот бы я мог ещё раз увидеть тебя!.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Precisamente. ......Este é o milagre final pelo qual anseio enquanto ainda estou vivo. A minha magia final.......Quando um milagre ocorrer e permitir que determinada pessoa resolva aquele inescrutável epitáfio, .........certamente significará a ressurreição da {f:5:Beatrice}. ......Ohhh, {f:5:Beatrice}... Eu só quero ver seu rosto mais uma vez... Eu não preciso mais de dinheiro ou honra. Se eu apenas pudesse vê‐la mais uma vez......!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「是的。………這是我人生最後的願望，最後的奇跡。最後的魔法。……在解開那難解的碑文之謎的奇跡，到來之時，………這定將意味著，貝阿朵莉切的復活。……哦——，貝阿朵莉切喲…。我好想見你，我想再見一次你的面容…。我已經財富也好名譽也罷，什麼都不需要了。只求能再見你最後一面……！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「是的。………这是我人生最后的愿望，最后的奇迹。最后的魔法。……在解开那难解的碑文之谜的奇迹，到来之时，………这定将意味着，贝阿朵莉切的复活。……哦——，贝阿朵莉切哟…。我好想见你，我想再见一次你的面容…。我已经财富也好名誉也罢，什么都不需要了。只求能再见你最后一面……！」

Russian (RU): Но когда Мария начала что‐то радостно записывать, а я сидела без дела...... должна признать, я вздохнула и взглянула на небо, проследив, чтобы она не заметила......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas quando a Maria começava a desenhar algo alegremente e eu apenas ficava sentada por um tempo, ......eu devo admitir que havia momentos em que eu suspirava e olhava para o céu, cuidando para ter certeza que ninguém perceberia......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過，妾身是說不出，在真里亞開心地集中精神寫起什麼，把妾身孤零零地擱在一邊時，……妾身從未有過，邊小心不讓她察覺到，邊輕嘆一口氣仰望天空，這種話的……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过，妾身是说不出，在真里亚开心地集中精神写起什么，把妾身孤零零地搁在一边时，……妾身从未有过，边小心不让她察觉到，边轻叹一口气仰望天空，这种话的……。

Umineko Project (UP): ......It's fun to increase the numbers of our minions.{n}They make things lively, so I do not tire of it.
Steam (ST): ...It's fun to increase the numbers of our minions. They make things lively, so I do not tire of it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......It's fun to increase the numbers of our minions. They make things lively, so I do not tire of it.
PC Japanese (JP): ……眷属が、増えることは楽しい。賑やかだし、飽きぬ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……眷属が、増えることは楽しい。{n}賑やかだし、飽きぬ。
Russian (RU): ......Увеличивать число наших последователей весёлое занятие.{n}Они оживляют обстановку, и мне не надоедает.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......É divertido aumentar o nosso número de familiares.{n}Eles animam as coisas, por isso não me canso deles.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……增加眷屬是件樂事。{n}又熱鬧，又不會讓人膩。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……增加眷属是件乐事。{n}又热闹，又不会让人腻。

Umineko Project (UP): I may have tired of my minions alone, but when I can interact with Maria's minions as well, that does not happen.
Steam (ST): I may have tired of my minions alone, but even that problem goes away when I can interact with Maria's as well.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I may have tired of my minions alone, but when I can interact with Maria's minions as well, that does not happen.
PC Japanese (JP): 妾の眷属だけでは飽きることもあろうが、真里亞の眷属と交流していれば、それもない。
Russian (RU): Мне может надоесть общаться со своими последователями, но не с последователями Марии.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu posso ter me cansado dos meus familiares, mas quando posso interagir com os familiares da Maria, o mesmo não acontece.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖在只有妾身的眷屬時也感到過膩吧，但只要有了與真里亞的眷屬的交流，就沒這種事了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽在只有妾身的眷属时也感到过腻吧，但只要有了与真里亚的眷属的交流，就没这种事了。

Umineko Project (UP): It takes two people to create a universe. I now have that second person, so I am satisfied.
Steam (ST): It takes two people to create a universe. I now have that second person, so I am satisfied.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It takes two people to create a universe. I now have that second person, so I am satisfied.
PC Japanese (JP): 宇宙を生み出すには、二人いる。今の妾には、その二人目がいるからこそ、満たされているのだ。
Russian (RU): Для создания вселенной нужны двое. Теперь у меня есть второй человек, так что я довольна.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): É preciso duas pessoas para criar um universo. Eu estava satisfeita pois agora tinha essa segunda pessoa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 創造宇宙，必須得有兩人。現在的妾身，是正因有了這第二個人，才得以心滿意足。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 创造宇宙，必须得有两人。现在的妾身，是正因有了这第二个人，才得以心满意足。

Umineko Project (UP): After all, it is so much fun playing with Maria that time seems to fly on by.
Steam (ST): After all, it's so much fun playing with Maria that time seems to fly on by.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): After all, it's so much fun playing with Maria that time seems to fly on by.
PC Japanese (JP): だって、こうして真里亞と一緒に遊んでいる時は、時が立つのも忘れるほどに楽しい。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): だって、こうして真里亞と一緒に遊んでいる時は、時が経つのも忘れるほどに楽しい。
Russian (RU): Ведь с Марией так весело играть, что время летит незаметно.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Afinal, é tão divertido brincar com a Maria que o tempo parece voar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 畢竟，在像這樣與真里亞一起玩時，開心到了忘記時間的流逝。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 毕竟，在像这样与真里亚一起玩时，开心到了忘记时间的流逝。

Umineko Project (UP): But even so, ......when I look up at the sky, ......during those short moments, I feel an empty feeling I cannot describe...
Steam (ST): But even so, ...when I look up at the sky, ...during those short moments, I feel an empty feeling I can't describe...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): But even so, ......when I look up at the sky, ......during those short moments, I feel an empty feeling I can't describe...

Chinese Simplified (CN): 但是，尽管如此，……在忽然仰望天空时，……妾身还是能感到，存在于那微微的一条缝里的，无法言喻的空虚…。

Steam (ST): My apologies to Maria, ...but she is not the second person I want to create a universe with.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): My apologies to Maria, ......but she is not the second person I want to create a universe with.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Não importa o quanto eu nutra o meu mundo com ela, ......as raízes do amor em meu coração deixam vazios.

Chinese Simplified (CN): ……不论与真里亚培育出多大的宇宙，……胸中的恋之根，都会撑开那一条缝。

Umineko Project (UP): He left saying he would come for me riding a white horse, ......and I was the only one without a letter.
Steam (ST): He left saying he'd come for me riding a white horse, ...and I was the only one without a letter.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): He left saying he'd come for me riding a white horse, ......and I was the only one without a letter.

Russian (RU): Он ушёл, сказав, что приедет за мной на белом коне...... и я единственная осталась без письма.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ele foi embora dizendo que voltaria por mim montado em um cavalo branco, ......e eu fui a única que ficou sem uma carta.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 他留下了句，会骑着白马来接我，……却唯独不给妾身，写一封信。

Steam (ST): And he even said that he probably wouldn't be returning to Rokkenjima...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And he even said that he probably wouldn't be returning to Rokkenjima......

Umineko Project (UP): {i:This}.........is love? ......I always believed that love was so much sweeter, so much more intoxicating.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): Is this.....love?......I always believed that love was so much sweeter, so much more intoxicating.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): But now, I don't know anymore.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas agora, eu já não sei mais.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但是，到了現在已經不明白了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但是，到了现在已经不明白了。

Umineko Project (UP): Though I long for him so much it's maddening, ......I can sometimes feel hatred underneath.
Steam (ST): Though I long for him so much it's maddening, ...I can sometimes feel hatred underneath.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Though I long for him so much it's maddening, ......I can sometimes feel hatred underneath.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Embora eu anseie tanto por ele que chega a ser enlouquecedor, ......algumas vezes eu sinto um ódio por baixo disso.

Steam (ST): However, even that hatred is wrapped in adoration.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, even that hatred is wrapped in adoration.

Umineko Project (UP): The roots of love have remained in the corners of my heart all this time.
Steam (ST): The roots of love have remained in the corners of my heart all this time.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The roots of love have remained in the corners of my heart all this time.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): Even though, at some point, ......I gave up hoping that Battler would return.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 明明在心中某处都认为，……“战人也许再也不会回来了”地放弃了。

Steam (ST): However, the roots of love stayed right where they were.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, the roots of love stayed right where they were.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 但是，恋之根却纹丝不动，深深地扎根在妾身的心中。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Em outras palavras, ......mesmo após quatro anos, eu ainda acredito.

Umineko Project (UP): He will come back someday.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): He will come back someday.

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 他總有一天，一定會回來。

Steam (ST): The flower of my love has curled up and withered as though against the winter cold.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The flower of my love has curled up and withered as though against the winter cold.

Russian (RU): Цветок моей любви свернулся и увял, словно от зимнего холода.

Steam (ST): However, the root is still alive.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, the root is still alive.

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但是，它的根活著。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但是，它的根活着。

Steam (ST): ...And, it is always, always waiting for him to return, waiting for a chance to bloom beautifully again.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......And, it is always, always waiting for him to return, waiting for a chance to bloom beautifully again.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......E assim resistem, aguardando o dia em que ele certamente retornará, esperando uma oportunidade para florescerem lindamente novamente.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): Mariage Sorciere has eased the burden on my heart so much.

Steam (ST): I only thought he was giving out a hint about the epitaph...

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Fui eu quem acabei pensando que poderia ser uma dica sobre o epitáfio...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 妾身是把這誤會成了，“這肯定是碑文的提示”了吧…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 妾身是把这误会成了，“这肯定是碑文的提示”了吧…。

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Umineko Project (UP): "So, the reward for the fool blinded by gold is dust. *cackle*cackle*, nice one, Genji."
Steam (ST): "So, the reward for the fool blinded by gold is dust. *cackle*cackle* Nice one, Genji."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「黄金に目の眩んだ愚か者への褒美は、埃塗れというわけか。くっくくく、源次め、やってくれるわ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「黄金に目の眩んだ愚か者への褒美は、埃塗れというわけか。くっくくく、源次め、やってくれるわ」
Russian (RU): "Пыль — вот награда для дуры, ослеплённой золотом. *хи‐хи*хи‐хи*, отлично сработано, Генджи."

Umineko Project (UP): I tossed the book aside, used magic to turn a bookshelf into a sofa, and plopped down on top of it.
Steam (ST): I tossed the book aside, used magic to turn a bookshelf into a sofa, and plopped down on top of it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Umineko Project (UP): For a while, I gazed up at the ceiling as I grumbled about getting tricked.
Steam (ST): For a while, I grumbled about getting tricked and looked up at the ceiling.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): For a while, I grumbled about getting tricked and looked up at the ceiling.
PC Japanese (JP): しばらくの間、やられたやられたと愚痴り、天井を見上げた。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por um tempo, eu fiquei encarando o teto enquanto resmungava sobre como tinha sido enganada.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 在那一小会儿间，边抱怨着“被摆了一道”，边仰望天花板。

Umineko Project (UP): Then, I cast my eyes down at the floor, thinking that I would feel a lot better if I gathered all this room's dust, packed it into a ball, and tossed it into Genji's teacup.
Steam (ST): I was annoyed, so I felt like gathering all this room's dust, packing it into a ball, and tossing it into Genji's teacup, so I glanced down at the floor.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I was annoyed, so I felt like gathering all this room's dust, packing it into a ball, and tossing it into Genji's teacup, so I glanced down at the floor.
PC Japanese (JP): 悔しいから、この部屋の埃でも集めて玉にして、源次の湯のみの中にでも浮かべてやろうかと思い、床に目を落とす。
Russian (RU): Я разозлилась, захотела собрать всю пыль этой комнаты в шарик, а потом бросить его в чашку Генджи, и мой взгляд упал на пол.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E então, eu direcionei meu olhar ao chão, pensando que eu me sentiria melhor se juntasse toda a poeira daquele cômodo, amontoasse em uma bola e jogasse na xícara de chá do Genji.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 因為很窩火，所以妾身想著，“把這房間的塵埃聚成一個球，讓它浮在源次的茶杯裡”，而把目光落向了地面。

Steam (ST): The book I had thrown away lay open on the ground.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The book I had thrown away lay open on the ground.

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 黃金蝶，停在了這一頁上。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 黄金蝶，停在了这一页上。

Umineko Project (UP): .........Tossing a book at random and reading an oracle from the page it happens to open to is one kind of charm.
Steam (ST): ...Tossing a book at random and reading an oracle from the page it happens to open to is a kind of ritual.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Tossing a book at random and reading an oracle from the page it happens to open to is one kind of charm.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): .........Jogar um livro aleatoriamente e ler um oráculo da página que acabou abrindo também é uma espécie de feitiço.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): Oddly enough, it was a page about rivers and lakes......

Steam (ST): There were six major rivers listed. Zhuoshui River. Kaoping River. Danshui River. Dajia River. Zengwun River. Dadu River.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): There were six major rivers listed. Zhuoshui River. Kaoping River. Danshui River. Dajia River. Zengwun River. Dadu River.

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 主要な河川としては、以下の６つが数えられる。{n}濁水渓。高屏渓。淡水河。大甲渓。曽文渓。大肚渓。
Russian (RU): Были перечислены шесть крупных рек.{n}Река Чжошуйци. Река Гаопин. Река Даньшуй. Река Дайя. Река Чжуинху. Река Даду.

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Umineko Project (UP): "Hoh. Now then, could any of these rivers have had sweetfish in them...or not?"
Steam (ST): "Hoh. Now then, which of these rivers might have sweetfish in them?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Hoh. Now then, which of these rivers might have sweetfish in them?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「ほう。さて、これらの川には鮎は住めたのか、否か。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ほう。さて、これらの川には鮎は住めたのか、否か」

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「呵——。那么，接下来就看这些河流是否适合鲇鱼生息了。」

Umineko Project (UP): Then, I had a shocking realization.
Steam (ST): An idea came to me then.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): An idea came to me then.
PC Japanese (JP): そこでふと思い当たり、呆れる。
Russian (RU): И тогда ко мне пришла идея.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então, tive um choque de realidade.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 在此，妾身忽然想到了一件事，然后觉得此事甚傻。

Umineko Project (UP): Sweetfish are freshwater fish. And you don't find ocean water in rivers.
Steam (ST): Sweetfish are freshwater fish. And you don't find ocean water in rivers.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Sweetfish are freshwater fish. And you don't find ocean water in rivers.
PC Japanese (JP): 鮎は淡水魚だ。そして川に海水が流れるはずもない。
Russian (RU): Айю — пресноводные рыбы, а в реках нет океанской воды.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ayus são peixes de água doce. E você não encontra água do mar em rios.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 鮎魚是淡水魚。並且，河裡不可能流著海水。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 鲇鱼是淡水鱼。并且，河里不可能流着海水。

Umineko Project (UP): ......Unless it's extremely dirty or blocked by a dam, any river might have sweetfish in it.
Steam (ST): ...Unless it's extremely dirty or blocked by a dam, any river might have sweetfish in it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……よほど汚かったり、ダムで塞き止めでもしない限り、川と名さえ付けば、どこの川だって鮎は住めるではないか。
Russian (RU): ......Айю может быть в любых реках, если они не слишком загрязнены и не перегорожены плотинами.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......A não ser que esteja extremamente suja ou bloqueada por uma represa, qualquer rio poderia ter ayus.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……除非是髒到一定境界，或被大壩堵住斷流，否則只要名字裡有個河字，就不論哪條河都能供鮎魚生息吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……除非是脏到一定境界，或被大坝堵住断流，否则只要名字里有个河字，就不论哪条河都能供鲇鱼生息吧。

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Umineko Project (UP): "How foolish. All rivers have fresh water in them. What's stopping sweetfish from living in any river? ............Come to think of it, what a foolish name this Tamsui River has. Freshwater River? What sort of river isn't a freshwater river? Why not at least wait for something besides fresh water to flow down it and name it after that instead?"
Steam (ST): "How foolish. All rivers have freshwater in them. What's stopping sweetfish from living in any river? ......Come to think of it, what a foolish name this Danshui River has. Freshwater River? What sort of river isn't a freshwater river? It would only make sense to name a river after what's in it if it were literally anything else."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "How foolish. All rivers have freshwater in them. What's stopping sweetfish from living in any river? .........Come to think of it, what a foolish name this Danshui River has. Freshwater River? What sort of river isn't a freshwater river? A thing with freshwater flowing down it is practically the definition of 'river'."
PC Japanese (JP): 「馬鹿らしい。川ならどこだって淡水だ。鮎の住めぬ道理はないわ。…………そう考えれば、この淡水河なる川の馬鹿らしいことよ。川に淡水が流れるのは当然であろうが。淡水以外が流れて初めて、それを川の名にすれば良かろうに。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「馬鹿らしい。川ならどこだって淡水だ。鮎の住めぬ道理はないわ。…………そう考えれば、この淡水河なる川の馬鹿らしいことよ。川に淡水が流れるのは当然であろうが。淡水以外が流れて初めて、それを川の名にすれば良かろうに」
Russian (RU): "Как глупо. Во всех реках пресноводная вода. Что мешает айю обитать в любой реке?.........Если подумать, до чего глупое название у этой реки Даньшуй. Пресноводная Река? Какая река не пресноводная? Стекающая пресная вода само по себе определение реки."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Que idiotice. Todos os rios têm água doce. O que impediria um peixe ayu de viver em qualquer rio? ............Pensando nisso, esse Rio Tamsui tem um nome ridículo. Rio Água Doce? Tem algum tipo de rio que não tenha água doce?{n}Por que esperar por algo além de água doce que flua e seja nomeada assim?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「傻透了。河的話，不論哪的都是淡水。不可能不適合鮎魚生息。…………這麼一想，這條叫淡水河的河，真是挺傻的。“河裡流淌著淡水”，這是理所當然的事吧？等哪天有不流淡水，流別的什麼的了，再給河取這名也不遲吧。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「傻透了。河的话，不论哪的都是淡水。不可能不适合鲇鱼生息。…………这么一想，这条叫淡水河的河，真是挺傻的。“河里流淌着淡水”，这是理所当然的事吧？等哪天有不流淡水，流别的什么的了，再给河取这名也不迟吧。」

Umineko Project (UP): Tamsui River flows from Taipei to the harbor town of Tamsui.
Steam (ST): Danshui River flows from Taipei to the harbor town of Danshui.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Danshui River flows from Taipei to the harbor town of Danshui.
PC Japanese (JP): 淡水河は、台北から、港湾都市“淡水”へ向けて流れている。
Russian (RU): Река Даньшуй течёт из Тайбэя в портовый город Даньшуй.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O Rio Tamsui flui de Taipei até a cidade portuária de Tamsui.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 淡水河，是條從台北向港灣都市“淡水”流去的河流。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 淡水河，是条从台北向港湾都市“淡水”流去的河流。

Umineko Project (UP): I see—it isn't called that because of the water in it, but because of the town at its mouth.
Steam (ST): I see, it isn't called that because of the water in it, but because of the town at its mouth.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I see, it isn't called that because of the water in it, but because of the town at its mouth.
PC Japanese (JP): なるほど、淡水が流れてるからではなく、河口の町の名が川となったのか。
Russian (RU): Вот как, она называется так не из‐за воды, а из‐за города в её устье.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Entendi — ele não é chamado assim por causa da água, mas por causa da cidade que é a sua nascente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 原來如此，並不是因為流著淡水，而是因為，是以河口城市的名字命名河的麼？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 原来如此，并不是因为流着淡水，而是因为，是以河口城市的名字命名河的么？

Umineko Project (UP): ............As you travel down it, you will see a village.{n}In that village, look for the shore the two speak of.
Steam (ST): ......As you travel down the river, you will see a village. In that village, look for the shore the two will tell you of.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ............As you travel down the river, you will see a village. In that village, look for the shore the two will tell you of.

Speaker: Clair
Umineko Project (UP): "We treated this riddle as a sort of game. And all of the servants were engrossed in it."
Steam (ST): "To me, solving this riddle was like a game. One that all of the servants were engrossed in."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "To me, solving this riddle was like a game. All of the servants were engrossed in this riddle-solving game."

Speaker: Clair
Umineko Project (UP): "I was just trying to be one of that group. ......I had long since run out of books that I could become enthusiastic about, so, out of boredom, I took that book back with me to my own room and looked through it every night."
Steam (ST): "I was just trying to be one of that group. ...For quite some time, I had suffered from a lack of books I could find particularly absorbing, and I was very bored. So, I took that book back with me to my own room...and looked through it every night."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "I was just trying to be one of that group. ......I had lost all books that I could become enthusiastic about and was very bored. So, I took that book back with me to my own room...and looked through it every night."

Speaker: Willard H. Wright
Umineko Project (UP): "Rosa's theory went like this. She read the "Home" ({p:0:郷}) kanji as "kyou" and interpreted it as {ruby:kyou:{p:0:京}}, which she took as short for "Kyoto" ({ruby:kyouto:{p:0:京都}}). Then, she reasoned that if you take a ten‐day trip from the beloved hometown to Kyoto, there might be some secret at the end of the first tenth of that journey. .........It was a good theory, but she just missed the mark. {p:0:京} has another meaning besides Kyoto."
Steam (ST): "By Rosa's reasoning, "attain to" meant reaching some physical location represented by the four treasures. ...It was a good try, but not quite right. It's not the treasures we're supposed to reach, but their power."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Since our journey to the Golden Land ends on the tenth twilight, this is either the capital of the place called the Golden Land...or the Golden Land itself. Rosa guessed that it might be the latter.""She searched for a link between the two words...and found one. If you write the name out in Japanese... and then check the pronunciation, you get Ougon Kyou. Then, just find a way to write it that gives you Golden Capital. There are several words that can mean capital in Japanese and several words pronounced 'kyou'. But...""...There's only one character that fits in here." "The character {p:0:京}... But doesn't that one also mean Kyoto, the old capital of Japan?" "Yes. And that's exactly what Rosa thought. Kyoto is the tenth twilight, and the journey starts at the beloved hometown. So, the letters are 'sacrificed' from the first twilight, or the spot one tenth of way to Kyoto. It was a good theory, but not quite right. {p:0:京} has yet another meaning."
PC Japanese (JP): 「楼座の推理はこうだった。黄金の“郷”をキョウと読み、京都の“京”と読み解いた。そして、懐かしき故郷から京都までの十日かかる旅路を十分の一した地点に、何か秘密があると疑った。………いい推理だったが惜しかった。“京”は京都以外にも読み解けたんだ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「楼座の推理はこうだった。黄金の“郷”をキョウと読み、京都の“京”と読み解いた。そして、懐かしき故郷から京都までの十日かかる旅路を十分の一した地点に、何か秘密があると疑った。………いい推理だったが惜しかった。“京”は京都以外にも読み解けたんだ」
Russian (RU): "Теория Розы звучит так. Она прочла иерголиф 'дом' ({p:0:郷}) как 'кё', и увидев анаграмму на {ruby:кьё:{p:0:京}}, она решила, что он вляется отсылкой к Киото ({ruby:кьёто:{p:0:京都}}). Отсюда она сделала вывод, что если совершить десятидневное путешествие из любимого города в Киото, то в конце первого дня можно натолкнуться на какой‐то секрет. Хорошая теория, но не совсем верная. У {p:0:京} есть и другое значение."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "A teoria da Rosa era algo assim. Então, ela deduziu que se você fizer uma viagem de dez dias, indo da amada cidade passada até Quioto, poderia haver algum segredo ao final da viagem de dez dias. .........Foi uma boa teoria, mas foi na direção contrária do ponto principal. {p:0:京} tem outro significado além de Quioto."
